gw.api.bean.compare.ui

Class PropertyDiffDisplay

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.bean.compare.ui.PropertyDiffDisplay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DiffDisplay

    public class PropertyDiffDisplay
extends Object
implements DiffDisplay
    Superclass for displaying property diffs in the policy refresh comparison UI. This class can be used as is or subclassed by customers to give more control over the UI. There is no direct mechanism for customers to specifytheir own subclass (or alternative implementation) for PropertyDiffDisplay. The only approach at the moment is to override the {@link HierarchicalDiff#addChild(DiffDisplay)} method in the DiffDisplay object used to display an entity (typically some subclass of {@link gw.api.bean.compare.ui.EntityDiffDisplay}). The addChild method can then watch for incoming children of type PropertyDiffDisplay and replace them with a custom subtype or alternative type.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      PropertyDiff<Object> Diff
      Return the underlying property diff that this PropertyDiffDisplay is displaying
      String Label
      The label used in the UI when displaying a property difference. The default implementation looks for a display key of the form entity.TypeName.PropertyName (for example entity.Person.LastName) where TypeName is the name of the type that owns the property and PropertyName is the property's name. If no such display key exists then the name of the property is used as it is. Normally display keys should be defined for all properties that may be displayed, the name of the property is not usually a good UI label.
      String NewValue
      The new value of the property, as a user displayable string. Returns the empty string if the new value is null
      String OldValue
      The old value of the property, as a user displayable string. Returns the empty string if the old value is null.
      DiffDisplay.Type Type
      The type of this difference - has the property changed and, if so, has its value been added or removed?

      • Fields inherited from class java.lang.Object

        Class

      • Label

        String Label
        The label used in the UI when displaying a property difference. The default implementation looks for a display key of the form entity.TypeName.PropertyName (for example entity.Person.LastName) where TypeName is the name of the type that owns the property and PropertyName is the property's name. If no such display key exists then the name of the property is used as it is. Normally display keys should be defined for all properties that may be displayed, the name of the property is not usually a good UI label.
